skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...
skill.author: Cam10001110101

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation files with communication guidelines and templates. There is no executable code, network access, file system operations, or external command execution. The skill is purely instructional content for formatting internal communications.

content.value_statement: Streamline your internal communication workflow with AI-powered templates for 3P updates, newsletters, and FAQs. Get consistent, professional communications that follow your company's preferred formats.
actual_capabilities: Generate 3P (Progress, Plans, Problems) updates for teams
Create company-wide newsletters with proper formatting
Write professional FAQ responses for employees
Format general internal communications with company style
Follow specific guidelines for executive communications
limitations: Requires manual input of team information and updates
Does not access real company data or systems
Formatting must be manually verified against company standards
Cannot automatically gather information from company tools

use_cases.title: Weekly 3P Updates for Leadership
use_cases.description: Create concise weekly updates highlighting team progress, upcoming plans, and current blockers for executive review.

use_cases.title: Company Newsletter Creation
use_cases.description: Compile company-wide announcements and updates into professional newsletters for Slack and email distribution.

use_cases.title: Employee FAQ Responses
use_cases.description: Draft clear, professional answers to common employee questions about policies, procedures, and company updates.

prompt_templates.title: Basic 3P Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the Engineering team covering this week. Progress: Deployed new feature X. Plans: Working on performance improvements. Problems: Database latency issues.

prompt_templates.title: Company Newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a company newsletter with these updates: New product launch, 50 new hires, office expansion, and upcoming all-hands meeting.

prompt_templates.title: FAQ Response
prompt_templates.scenario: Employee question about remote work policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a professional FAQ response explaining our updated remote work policy effective next month, including 3 days office requirement.

prompt_templates.title: Incident Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft an internal communication about yesterday's 2-hour service outage, including cause, impact, and prevention measures for the Product team.

output_examples.input: Create a 3P update for Marketing team: launched email campaign, planning social media push, budget constraints
output: Progress: Successfully launched Q1 email campaign targeting 50k subscribers with 25% open rate.
Plans: Executing social media push across LinkedIn and Twitter with daily content scheduled.
Problems: Budget constraints limiting paid promotion opportunities for next two weeks.

best_practices: Always specify your team name and date range for 3P updates
Include metrics and data when possible to make updates concrete
Keep communications concise and scannable for busy executives
anti_patterns: Writing overly long updates that exceed 3 sentences per section
Using jargon or team-specific terminology without explanation
Forgetting to include the emoji and team name in 3P updates

faq.question: Which communication types does this skill support?
faq.answer: 3P updates, newsletters, FAQs, general internal communications, incident reports, and project updates.

faq.question: Do I need to provide all the information manually?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill provides formatting templates but requires you to input the actual content and data.

faq.question: Can this access my company's Slack or email?
faq.answer: No, it cannot access any company systems. You must provide all information directly.

faq.question: How long should 3P updates be?
faq.answer: Keep each section to 1-3 sentences that can be read in 30-60 seconds total.

faq.question: What if my communication doesn't fit any template?
faq.answer: Use the general communications template and specify your audience, purpose, and tone requirements.

faq.question: Can I customize the formatting?
faq.answer: The skill follows specific formatting guidelines. For custom formats, request general communications with your requirements.
